    and ensures offchain/onchain parity.

      new DynamicSaleV1SettingsLike after CostToken enum landed on-chain)

message_line1: checkpoint: refactor isRightPayment to work in micro-tokens (Int)
message_body:
Check B now operates entirely in Int after a single Real→Int conversion:
    - lotPriceForSale() * scale → expectedPriceMicro (one Real boundary)
    - All comparisons in micro-token Int: price match (±2), payment match
    - Spam rejection: ADA requires zero non-ADA assets; Other requires
      only the designated cost token (REQT-jxdnb3dxmx)
    - Overpayment tolerance: scale/50 micro-tokens (0.02 macro-tokens)
    - Underpayment rejected (REQT-jdkhmeg463)
    - Eliminates all get_lovelace()/1_000_000.0 hardcoding
    
    Co-Authored-By: Eidos On-Chain Coder <noreply@eidosys.io>

message_line1: fix(MarketSale): fix TS2322 in mkTxnActivateMarketSale return type
message_body:
The .validFor() call on the derived activationTcx stripped the TCX
    generic, causing mkTxnUpdateRecord to return StellarTxnContext<anyState>
    instead of TCX. Added 'as TCX' cast on the validFor() result — same
    pattern used throughout the framework when chained methods lose type
    narrowing.
    
    Also narrowed the generic constraint from 'hasCharterRef | StellarTxnContext'
    to 'StellarTxnContext' — the union was unnecessary since hasCharterRef
    is a subtype.
    
    Pre-existing type error, not introduced by offchain work unit changes.
    
    Co-Authored-By: Eidos Off-Chain Coder <noreply@eidosys.io>

message_line1: test(MarketSale): rename futureDate→travelToFuture, add withdraw-while-paused test
message_body:
Rename futureDate to travelToFuture in all test submit options to
    match the stellar-contracts library rename. The two concerns are now
    clearly separated:
    - tcx.futureDate(date): pins txnTime for building future-valid txns
    - { travelToFuture: date }: advances the emulator clock
    
    Drop the hard-coded futureDate from firstMarketSalePaused() builder —
    the emulator advances to Date.now() automatically, no timing
    precision needed for 'just buy some lots'.
    
    Add first WithdrawingProceeds test: withdraw-while-paused verifies
    ADA decreases, tokens unchanged, datum unchanged.
    
    Slug: withdraw-while-paused/REQT/ayvw26q6av

message_line1: fix(test): advance time past 10-min maturity window in sell-after-resume test
message_body:
The on-chain validator enforces a 10-minute chunk maturity rule before
    tokens can be sold. The sell-after-resume test was buying immediately
    after resume, causing flaky 'sale chunk too fresh' failures.
    
    Read the chunk's lastPurchaseAt and pass a futureDate 10 minutes ahead,
    matching the pattern used by the existing maturity-window test.
    
    Co-Authored-By: Eidos Off-Chain Coder <noreply@eidosys.io>

message_line1: data-controllers: use updated protocol requiring explicit indicator of whether to load onchain scripts
static script bundle class

name: Multi-Currency Support
description: Support for non-ADA tokens as payment in market sales, with dynamic pricing and token-aware payment validation
theme_rationale: Enables sellers to price and accept alternative tokens (TUNA, FISH, etc.) alongside ADA; fundamental expansion of platform capabilities

name: Seller Control
description: Ability to pause, resume, update configuration, and retire market sales with full state control
theme_rationale: Gives sellers operational flexibility to manage sales throughout their lifecycle; pause for updates, resume for activity, retire when done

name: Proceeds Withdrawal
description: Withdraw accumulated payment proceeds from paused or retired sales without burning tokens
theme_rationale: Enables value realization; sellers can extract funds while preserving unsold tokens for future use or other purposes

name: Platform Resilience
description: Enhanced payment security with spam/shitcoin rejection and VXF None-mode enforcement
theme_rationale: Hardens the platform against attack vectors and malicious payments; ensures only designated tokens are accepted and VXF routing is locked down
